rev.diff:
Line 21: Line 21:
Carlson planned to integrate the beenz system into the [[customer relationship management]] tools they offered to clients. After the sale of the company to Carlson, beenz account holders were given a period of time to redeem their beenz before it became integrated. After [[September 11 attacks|9/11]], Carlson's business (which was heavily reliant upon bank and airline points programmes) struggled and the beenz concept was shelved. Carlson did not renew the domain name.
Carlson planned to integrate the beenz system into the [[customer relationship management]] tools they offered to clients. After the sale of the company to Carlson, beenz account holders were given a period of time to redeem their beenz before it became integrated. After [[September 11 attacks|9/11]], Carlson's business (which was heavily reliant upon bank and airline points programmes) struggled and the beenz concept was shelved. Carlson did not renew the domain name.
â
In June 2008, CNET counted Beenz among the largest dotcom disasters.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://crave.cnet.co.uk/0,39029477,49296926-7,00.htm|title=The greatest defunct Web sites and dotcom disasters|publisher=CNET|date=2008-06-05|accessdate=2008-06-05 |archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20080607211845/http://crave.cnet.co.uk/0,39029477,49296926-7,00.htm <!-- Bot retrieved archive --> |archivedate = 2008-06-07}}</ref>
+
